Reviews.Title: “Lucky to get a room!”
Reviews.Author: CervezaFria
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at the BRIC and my husband's second. He stayed here 6 years ago when it was the Parisma Caribe and remembers the owners cooking breakfast and manning fhe front desk! We were both very, very happy with our stay and I can echo many of the comments posted already. Patti truly does make the best pancakes and is very patient if you are practicing your Mexican Spanish. We were unfortunate to have room 25 (balcony over busy Calle 28) but did not have to share the inside balcony with anyone so still had some great times sitting outside. I would recommend room 25 if you wanted a little more space - it seemed to be slightly larger than any of the others. All of the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly - even the poor overnight security who kindy said "buenas dias" every morning at 6:30am just before the end of his shift. Quiet, clean and simple - that's exactly what we were looking for. The free Internet is a really nice touch but wasn't availabe all of the time (faulty keyboard). Also, be sure to bring your own hair dryer and don't worry about beach towels - this great place provides them. Highly recommended and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bhondablue
Reviews.Content: wrote review last year that said fantastic, fantastic, fantastic. the BRIC was again all that and even better. the value, the personnel, the convience, location are perfect. i have been going to mexico for close to 30 years and this is really a most wonderful place to stay. Abril, check in and front desk always always smiling, happy and most important of all helps with anything you need or want. the rest of front staff are just as nice and always checking that all is well. patti, still makes pancakes that float and her breakfasts can keep you going all day. quiet at night and secure. 1/2 block to 5th ave and 2 to the beach (5 min). if you are going to playa - this is the place you want stay at if you can get a room. check out there site. pictures are very very accurate. only 14 rooms in this boutique hotel but if you get one it will make your vacation. can contact me if desired at bhondablue@q.com

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Find!”
Reviews.Author: melnics
Reviews.Content: What an amazing surprise! We stayed at the Bric hotel for a week and have enjoyed every minute of it. The grounds are well maintained and the whole area looks like an oasis. Our room is clean and the balcony is a nice area to sit out, enjoy the breeze and have glass of wine in the afternoon. The staff was very attentive and accommodating and always made you feel welcomed. The hotel is ideally located within a few minutes walk to 5th avenue and close to all the fantastic restaurants. Mamitas beach is just a short walk away. It‘s a great hotel, good value and we will most definitely stay here again when we go back to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Raregem
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at The Bric and it has not lost it's charm! The rooms were very clean and well maintained just like the beautiful courtyard. The staff just as helpful and caring. I was very ill one day and the cleaning lady was wonderful to me. Abril was her usual cheerful self with that welcoming smile and accommodating way. I enjoy being a short distance from 5th avenue and still being able to enjoy some quiet at night. Thank you for a wonderful stay .... I will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MuffieNanaimo
Reviews.Content: Very close to 5th Avenue, shops and many restaurants, yet very quiet. The beautiful Playa del Carmen beach is only a 6 minute walk away. The Bric is clean and affordable. Small pool and seating area with palm trees and shade. Pati's breakfast is excellent, and she is very friendly. All the staff are helpful and friendly, particularly Abril at the front desk. She will help you plan your day trips, and she speaks excellent English. It is very safe, with a locked gate and security attendant all night. I have stayed a the Bric Hotel twice now, and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: grosminet42
Reviews.Content: very good location,near 5th but far away from noise. Very neat and clean ,nice and helpful staff, good value for money, would return

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hospitality in a beautiful setting, steps from the famed 5th ave.”
Reviews.Author: rishi R
Reviews.Content: Well, the title says it all. This is no 5 ( or 4 star) hotel however, the property and room is super clean and well maintained. Great personal attention. Location is terrific for both the beach and 5th avenue. Kristen (owner) is just fabulous and so are all the other employees. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy, conveniently located in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: manustar73
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Bric hotel, and would recommend this place. This is a small, nice and cosy hotel. Our room was very clean and seemed to be recently renovated. The hotel is located just right off the busy 5th avenue but is very quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. Only issue worth mentioning: I had 2 tickets within the same day, while my rental car was legally parked in the street in front of the hotel. The same happened to another hotel guest. I had to do the trip to the police station twice to get my license plate back. First time the police officers acknowledge their mistake, but the second time they decided to make some money on me and I had to pay a 30 USD fine for a violation I never committed. Very upsetting.

Reviews.Title: “Really good trip”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: We spent 15 days there, we were two 25 friends, and we were really happy to stay there at this hotel.I t 's comfortable, nice, quiet and really close to the beach (5 min) and situated in the main street of playa del carmen..The staff is really nice, and the hotel is secured because the night you have always somebody at the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: Mariana P
Reviews.Content: Not only the hotel is beautiful and 2 blocks away from Mamitas beach, but also the staff members are ultra friendly and helpful. Needless to mention that everything was super clean and they offer organic soaps and shampoo :) The room's balcony was amazing and perfect to sit for a beer or smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandandc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Dec 2011 and fell in love with the place. Great staff and right off 5th avenue but super quiet. Just a few blocks from the beach. Room was on the small side but the price and atmosphere make up for that. First time to Playa del Carmen and will be back. Best beach ever to take long walks.

Reviews.Title: “The Bric Hotel-LOVE LOVE LOVE”
Reviews.Author: kristina S
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I planned this trip to playa as a girls getaway, and the bric hotel was awesome! The rooms are small and modest, but each room is equipped with a/c, a mini fridge, and a balcony, perfect accommodations for not being in your room long. There was so much to do, the staff will help you plan and set you up for any excursions you are interested in planning. We did a lobster boat cruise, with snorkeling and had a ball. The breakfast is good, pancakes, bacon, eggs, coffee, fresh fruit and juice, but get down there quickly it goes quick and by the time we finally made it down some days the buffet was looking pretty scarce. We did this deal through groupon, and got a hour long massage included in our deal, which was great! The massage is set up in a private cabana by the pool. We went during the first week of December (the 1st-6th) and while we were worried that the weather would not be warm enough, it was actually perfect! We went to the beach every day except two rainy days, and on those rainy days we got our massages at the hotel and chilled by the pool. If you are considering bringing your kids, I think that the bric hotel is very family friendly. I was regretting not bringing my 8 month old son, as playa is more chill, and more accommodating for children, than spring breaky cancun, people had their kids and babies everywhere, and the bric hotel also offers crib accommodations upon request. Over all we had a blast, the staff at the bric hotel is amazing! So nice, so friendly, we were literally served breakfast in our room one morning :) There is no alcohol in the hotel however, or a restaurant, but there are several shops and restaurants within walking distance (like 2 feet away from the hotel) where you can eat or purchase bottles to drink in your room. Will definitely return to the bric hotel one day!!! Hope the review was helpful in planning your vaycay

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Cody8654
Reviews.Content: The staff answered a lot of our questions during the stay, and was always polite and welcoming. When we had to leave early before breakfast one morning for a trip, the nice lady who makes breakfast found us a few things to munch on since we couldn't stay until 7:30 when breakfast starts. The front desk worker gave us a great day trip recommendation and we found it pretty easy to walk from BRIC to most places in Playa. The chocolate soap and honey shampoo they have in the bathrooms is fantastic. I just wish I could buy a larger bottle to take home. The drawbacks were that the lock on our room door was a bit stiff and so took a few minutes to open each time. We figured out the tricks eventually, but it would have been nice to not have to fiddle with the lock every day. Next, I remember booking a queen size bed but ended up with a full and a twin. It was no big deal since I was tired enough to sleep anywhere, but it's nice to have a bed that fits when you're tall. No big deal though. I'm sure the staff would have arranged something had I asked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quaint hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: The bric hotel is just steps from 5th ave. Nice breakfast every morning and friendly, helpful staff! Nice showers with hot water. We would return!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, secluded, Intimate Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Gordon M
Reviews.Content: The staff is 5 star! They make you feel like family. You would not get nearly the service and attention at a larger hotel. The BRIC is central to shopping, excellent restaurants and Caribbean charm. Everything is clean, fresh and inviting. Thanks especially to Abril and Gustavo....they are very helpful and a wealth of knowledge. A suggestion to the hotel...more comfortable seating around the pool would be a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place...”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bric Hotel in Playa and loved it! Everyone was so nice and we got a level of service that we wouldn't have gotten at a larger hotel. The breakfast cook had the usual eggs, bacon, cereal each morning but would then come over and offer to make us fresh traditional Mexican breakfasts with fresh fruit as well. The front desk staff were all so helpful! Whenever we had questions about where to go, what to see, etc they would go above and beyond for us. The place is a bit rustic in some ways but we thought that it added to the charm of the place. If you're someone that is used to staying at the 4 seasons then this place probably isn't for you but the charm, people, and location were all amazing! Its also only about 2 blocks from the beach, 1 block from 5th Avenue, and 1/2 block from Starbucks! :) I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Lush Garden Retreat”
Reviews.Author: lilla_vanilla
Reviews.Content: Its prime location and secluded tropical garden are Bric Hotel's biggest plus. It's real good value for money and perfect for travellers avoiding big tourist resorts. The rooms are decorated tastefully and cater for all your needs. Bric's staff has been really helpful and nice, especially when it comes to restaurant tips (the food was delicious!). I especially enjoyed the leafy garden with its small and private pool. It was exactly what I had been looking for to relax. The only small thing that bothered me was the slightly damp smell in the rooms - we were given a downstairs room at first and then moved upstairs, where the air was better. Also, due to a misunderstanding at the reception there was nobody to show us our room when we arrived at the airport late at night. We had to wait around for 45 minutes until we could check in. Regardless, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Tricia B
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel! Small, quiet with an awesome, helpful, friendly staff, who'll help you with everything from suggestions on where to eat, where to go and how to get there, wakeup calls and help booking tours and airport shuttles. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast, is only a few steps to Avenida 5 and a short walk to the beach. This part of town is also more mellow than further south (closer to the port) where it's more crowded and a lot louder. Amenities are basic, but rooms are clean with air-conditioning and a fridge. You can even dock your iPod into the alarm clock.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel on 5ta Avenida”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Both times I've been to Playa I've stayed here - can't say enough good things about the place. It's just off Quinta Avenida - so it's not too loud at night, but still centrally located and you can easily get to the ADO bus station or the docks (15-20 minute walk, or quick taxi ride). The breakfast is delicious, the rooms are nice, I love the pool and outdoor shower and the staff are friendly and glad to help you arrange tours and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at the BRIC”
Reviews.Author: atlanta_30338
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and friendly staff. Free breakfast (which is awesome). Only con: i was never sure what time the front desk was open, which made it hard to communicate with them.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in a Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: Damian H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an awesome trip to Playa Del Carmen. The Bric Hotel and it's staff were fantastic! They really made us feel welcome, helped us organize all of our excursions, booked massages for us, suggested places for us to dine on 5th street (which is literally 20 feet away, but still somehow doesn't add any noise to the quite location of the hotel) - and overall made the trip absolutely fantastic! We already miss it! Thanks again to Gustavo and everyone at the Bric for making it such a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Constance M
Reviews.Content: Great spot, helpful staff. Private, charming. It's a small and simple hotel, but wonderful none the less. The pool wasn't that warm, but who needs it when you are blocks to the beach. walking distance to main street restaurants etc...

Reviews.Title: “Life is good at the Bric”
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a lovely property and is small and simple but has plenty of comforts such as air conditioned rooms and private terraces as well as a refrigerator. The included breakfast was great. The real difference that sets this hotel apart from hotels that cost much more is the staff. They are warm and friendly, extremely helpful with any of your needs. Mark my words, by the time you leave you will want to include Abril and Gustavo on your Christmas card list.

Reviews.Title: “Simply an amazing experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Koby W
Reviews.Content: I can't give a big enough thanks to the Staff at the Bric hotel for making my vacation amazing! We had a couple minor issues with the room they put us in (ie: fridge didn't work) but the staff was quick to offer to move a new fridge in or move us to another room. About half way through our trip Hurricane Rina was threatening to hit us hard and the staff was quick to give us advice and things to expect. They brought us candels and told us to head to the nearest market to get food for the day since the whole town was closing up. The staff at the Bric was very professional, friendly, and by the end of our stay I felt like I was home! Thanks to everyone at the Bric. I will sorely miss you all! Oh! And if you have a few extra bucks... DEFINATELY get a massage there! Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Queenauggy
Reviews.Content: the room although small was very clean, and air condition. The hotel was very quiet. But close to everything, restaurants, night life, stores, taxis all within walking distance. The staff was very pleasant. Especially April very sweet and kind. The massage that was included was excellent. That was the hi-light of my stay at the Bric. Now for the cons, I ordered this trip thru groupons to which I've purchased several trips amongst other offers and they have been spot on. This offer lacked in the breakfast consisting of coffee no juice whatsoever. Cold cereal with warm milk and cold pancakes, toast. Pretty much a continental breakfast minus juice and bagel/rolls. But definitely not a buffet breakfast. But again they were so nice, the lady in the kitchen area made me some kind of nachos with melted cheese. Very good too. No worries restaurants are every. Next I was being over charged for taxes, in my email correspondence I was told 25us on the second day of my stay I was told my taxes were 39us. Once I mention Marcus is who I  corresponded with, it was back to 25us again. (Not nice)  My greatest disappointment was free wifi that never worked during my stay, although I was told they were working on it. On my last night I was told by the gentleman it was up and running, it must be my iPad then I told him my husband laptop doesn't receive the Bric wifi either, he pulled out his cell phone to show me it worked for him. How nice for him. Yet I had to pirate free wifi from cablemas gratis or mexico1 to make any contact with the USA. There are no phones in the room to make calls or to contact the front desk. This place considers itself a bed and breakfast. But if all you need is a bed and clean safe room for a good price, this is it. would I stay here again? Definitly! My wish would be a microwave down in the dining area and get that Wifi running.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay in october”
Reviews.Author: jaime b
Reviews.Content: We had a great 6night stay at the bric. The staff was extremely helpful with our entire trip. Great restaurant recommendations. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the hotel is in a great location. I would recommend this hotel and I would probably go back again. The only thing i can say is that the beds are a little hard but we were able to overlook since everything else was so great.

Reviews.Title: “Leak in the room & incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: lmp1204
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and simple: I woke up at 4 a.m. to water dripping on my face from the ceiling light fixture. I went to the hotel office but it was locked and there was no one there. I had to wait until someone showed up at 9 a.m. for them to change my room. Upon check out, I asked for a receipt. I noticed at the airport that MY CREDIT CARD WAS CHARGED FOR SOMEONE ELSE'S ROOM AND SERVICES. I called the hotel and the woman at the front desk was extremely rude about the situation and could not comprehend the problem. I had to start a dispute through my credit card company, so we'll see how that pans out. The beds are extremely uncomfortable. We stayed away from the pool for most of the time because it was dirty. It's a shame because it's a cute place and Playa del Carmen is truly lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pam K
Reviews.Content: The location of The Bric Hotel is wonderful. Steps away from everything you need but still a quiet retreat with a good breakfast to start your day. About a 5-7 minute walk to the ocean with plenty of options for a variety of scenes along the beachfront. The staff was very helpful and we never had to worry about finding someplace great to eat within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brandy J
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The staff was very accommodating and super friendly. The housekeeper did a great job cleaning our room everyday. (She even organized our stuff - it was a nice treat to come home to everyday!) The breakfast was ok - I don't like milk in my eggs, but other than that it was fresh and hot everyday. We had an upstairs corner room - the view was blocked by foliage, so if you want to see the pool I would request one of the side rooms. When we arrived the bedspread has a stain at the end of the bed. Most likely a sand or mud stain, but stains are yucky. Half way thru the week the bedspread was changed out without us requesting it, so that was nice. The price during the off season was great! I would definitely go back. BTW - the shower was good too! I have very long thick hair and the rain shower did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Bric”
Reviews.Author: Wilfam
Reviews.Content: I decided to try the Bric this trip, I did a bit of research, found most of the sites have it GPS'd incorrectly, the Bric is only .5 of a block to the West of 5th Avenue and a 5 minute or less walk to the beach clubs on the beach in Playa del Carmen it is not on the West Side of the 307. I quickly emailed the hotel and rec;d very quick responses letting me know their correct location as well as a bit of other requested information. I confirmed there is parking and yes there is, it is on the street around the hotel in a nice quiet location. I stayed for one night on the way through, enjoyed it so much I stayed for 3 nights upon my return to Playa. Check in was so fast, I was asked if I needed help with my bags, a quick explanation of breakfast etc and off to my room. My room was fantastic, simple and clean with a surprise awaiting me. On the shelf in front of me was a bottle of Red Wine, 2 beautiful blue wine glasses, Chips n Salsa ! A king bed, 2 side tables with lamps, a drawer and cupboard to the end of the bed (not crowded at all) was a Valet with TV remotes for TV and AC and a small very cold fridge to keep my water etc cold, Sliding Locking Glass doors are your main entrance off to the right is a Closet with Safe, the Bathroom had ample room and a nice shelf to put my goodies on as well as a nice basket of bathroom amenities. The breakfast was a nice surprise I stopped down for a coffee to take to the room while I was organizing myself, then off to break which was buffet style, tea, coffee, juice, water, toast, delicious pancakes, bacon and eggs along with a fruit, cereal, yoghurt bar. The food was very adequate and above what i really expected. Upon my return I learnt that 2 times per week they do a nice Mexican Breaky which was fantastic. The woman who was the chef was so gracious and sweet along with her helper I was thoroughly satisfied. Within 3 minutes of this little gem is a Starbucks, 5 - 10 restaurants and ample shopping. I loved it and will definitely return. Everyone I was in contact with was beyond helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Little Hotel in the Heart of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Jacob G
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and simple hotel in the heart of Playa del Carmen. The BRIC has a wonderful helpful staff. We used most of their suggestions for meals, diving, massage, directions and general thing to do, and we were extremely pleased. The BRIC is clean, secure, and great location. The included breakfast is simple, but good and healthy. We felt that it was a great value and good for couples and families. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: Bgladu
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Playa del Carmen, we were fortunate enough to have found the Bric Hotel. We very much enjoyed our five night stay. The intimate hotel was a welcome surprise. The rooms were quite comfortable, clean and offered all the conveniences necessary while traveling. The grounds were well maintained and the pool was always the perfect way to start and end the day. The staff was outstanding and very attentive to our needs, assisting with directions and local recommendations, including swimming with whale sharks currently in season. The complimentary breakfasts prepared daily, were delicious and definitely spoil you while away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great location, Great staff. We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: stvnmsts
Reviews.Content: We ended up in Playa del Carmen and stayed here at The Bric Hotel after some arrangements in Merida fell through . It was a great little place. At only 14 rooms it was quaint and comfortable. This was a welcome relief from the larger resorts that you see popping up around Playa. The staff was very welcoming and hospitable and were genuinely interested in our stay. Within a few minutes and a couple speed dial calls we were hooked up with snorkeling and swimming with whale sharks. The proprietors were on site and chatted with us daily. The location is perfect, right off 5th Ave, in the quieter, newer section, and a 2 minute walk to Mamitas beach. Breakfast was included and was delicious each day - eggs, bacon, fruit, assorted cereal, pancakes, coffee, juice, and a daily special. What a tremendous value this turned out to be for us and a welcome detour.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the resorts and enjoy the warm hospitality a B&B”
Reviews.Author: travlinterp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Bric for the last four nights of a two and half week trek through Central America. Having spent the better part of our time visiting family and friends our family was looking forward to some relaxing beach time. We arrived late but the front staff were very accommodating. The hotel is located steps from 5th Ave and yet you do not feel that you are in the midst of a major tourist area. Service was always personable. The front desk made arrangements for our Maya ruins tours and it was fabulous. Rooms were small but comfortable. I highly recommend it to anyone wanting to enjoy Playa but not just be a number in a big hotel. We are looking forward to getting back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: KeystoneTraveller
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the Bric Hotel....and where to start as I have stayed there over ten different times in my travels over the past year! First, the staff, one of the best in Playa, bilingual, great smiles from the front desk, the breakfast staff (you get a free breakfast to fill you up every day), night guards, housekeeping, property managers, accounting staff, owners, everyone...the beds, awesome - super comfortable rooms, love the private balconies, quick walk to beach, shops, restaurants, and SUPER quiet area to sleep at (which is hard to find in playa with the noisy bars when you get around 5th), I have recommended and booked many people there and they always have great reviews. Thanks Kristin and staff - you are all priceless and memories are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “It's a excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattydoll
Reviews.Content: The room and swimming pool are very clean. The staff is helpful and friendly. We had a problem with a car rental and the staff tried us to resolve it. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: laur9549
Reviews.Content: The Bric Hotel was in the perfect location at the north end of Quinta- close enough to the action, minutes from Mamitas beach, but still quiet and relaxing. The rooms are not fancy, but are comfortable and have everything you need (safe, small refrigerator, wifi, a/c). We found great restaurants near by, both on and off Quinta. It is also fairly close to Mega to buy groceries. The staff was always helpful and the breakfast was great! I still miss the fresh squeezed orange juice every morning. The rooms are arranged around a central courtyard with a pool and covered table/bar area where breakfast is served. The landscaping is beautiful and lush. The only drawback is that it is a bit of a walk in the heat from the bus station, but at least it's always entertaining. It was exactly what we were looking for and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “More than we imagined-Fantastic price!”
Reviews.Author: Erin82483
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are at the tail end of our 3 week stay at The Bric Hotel in Playa del Carmen, and we couldn't be happier with our choice. I wasn't sure what to expect from the breakfast that is included in the already low rates, but even after 3 weeks, I am not tired of Patti's cooking. She makes us eggs made to order and the best pancakes I have ever eaten. We are at a prime location, just off 5th avenue, and everything is within a very short walk. Mamitas beach is less than a 5 minute walk. Abril and Aurora, our receptionists, have been amazing. They are always helpful and eager to make recommendations for whatever we ask. The property is very small, but beautiful. Along with the greenery and rain comes lots of mosquitoes, so don't forget the bug spray. All in all...great value for an exceptional price, and we will most definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: ALEJANDRALEON
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, breakfast was delicious, Paty´s a splendid cook! The rooms are very comfortable and the location is excelent, just a few steps to get to the 5th. Definetively we´ll be back sometime. Bric hotel, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and super service”
Reviews.Author: PokerThomas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bric Hotel spring 2011. Fine hotel and the receptionist Abril was very friendly and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: misstynee
Reviews.Content: Great location, right in the heart of 5th Avenue action. But tucked away on a side street so that it is VERY quiet at night. Comfortable accommodations. Rate is awesome considering breakfast is included. Friendly and helpful staff. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: sandygalWi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bric Hotel April 4-11, 2011. I had read many reviews before selecting this hotel, and all the great things I read we experienced for ourselves! April at the front desk went out of her way to make us comfortable, and every request was met with a smile. The room, although basic, was adequate for our needs, and the upscale toiletries were the nicest I have ever actually used in a hotel. The bed was firm but comfortable, the balcony a lovely spot to relax with a drink, and the pool was so refreshing after a warm walk home from the beach. Our breakfast was delicious every morning, and Patty was a real sweetheart who greeted us warmly every day. The location was excellent, the Starbucks was a ten second walk down the street, the beach less than five minutes, and being in the heart of Little Italy was the perfect area in Playa. We would go back in a heartbeat, and would recommend it without reserve for anyone who would like to experience true Mexican hospitality out side of the more "plastic" all inclusives. Thank you Bric, for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little oasis in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Gohabsgo1954
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Bric hotel for a week March 17/23. What an unexpected surprise!! The location is fantastic,the staff was very nice and always happy to help ,the breakfast included in our price was large and hearthy. The hotel itself is beautiful;great little pool lush vegetation and the rooms are well equipped(in-room safe,wi-fi,cable).And it is steps away from the beach and also from 5th avenue and all the action if you care for it because the hotel itself is very quiet at all times which is great if you need to relax.Thank's a lot BRIC HOTEL !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the BRIC!”
Reviews.Author: nojunkplease
Reviews.Content: Great location. Right on the 5th street paseo and a quick walk to the beach. Near the action but quite. Interior courtyard and pool lovely, relaxing and well maintained. Rooms clean and well laid out with good sized covered balconies and refrigerator. Free breakfast well above average and a great staff. Not my first or last time there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!! GREAT VALUE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: andybern020
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, affordable and great location! The pool and surrounding are lovely and very well maintained. The rooms are simple but clean and you have your own little balcony where you can just read and relax. The staff at the front dest are amazing! Always very friendly, courteous and helpful. A "special" thanks to Abril. The breakfast in the morning is the best, you must try their freshly squeezed orange juice. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: staradew
Reviews.Content: After reading so many excellent reviews of this hotel in Playa Del Carmen, we were super excited to get going on our Mayan Riviera vacation and escape the cold of Vancouver. After a number of emails back and forth with the friendly staff at the hotel, which were all courteous and helpful, I was sure we would have the best time ever in Playa. Alas, this was not the case. At least 3 of the emails that I shared with the hotel had to do with our initial arrival at the airport in Cancun. At 9:55am (after a red eye from Seattle) our driver would be waiting outside the entrance with a sign with our name and the hotels name, and then the van service take us the 40 min away from Cancun to Playa del Carmen. Pretty easy you would think right? No, not so much. After a few painstaking minutes of being harassed as to whether or not we needed a ride to our hotel from the hundreds of would be drivers hanging out outside the airport, and not being able to find our sign, I made a call to the hotel. We were told the driver should be there any minute. And then 15 minutes later another call......oh sorry, he should be there any time now. 30 minutes later, the driver arrived and apparently thought we were supposed to be picked up at 1pm. Weird since I have like 9 emails to and from the hotel that we were arriving at 9:30am. Ok, whatever. No big deal, we're on vacation in Mexico and there were cold cerveza's to be had right outside the airport doors. We can deal with waiting a few minutes. The drive to the hotel was easy and pretty fast, but then we arrived at the hotel only for the check-in desk curious as to who we were and were we to be checking in? Ummmm, ya. Here are the printed versions of my million of emails back and forth to you guys about the reservation dates, the confirmation, oh and let's not forget that you had us on the list for a driver to pick us up today at the airport, though be it at the incorrect time (?) so yes, I would say that we were to be checking in today. Well, they did not have us checking in on the Saturday, but on the Sunday. Luckily, there was a room to be had and they squeezed the 3 of us in to a room for 1 night to then be moved to our actual room on the next day for the duration of our stay. A bigger better room for the 3 of us to relax in for the next 7 days. Not a bigger room after all, but was on the ground floor with a patio overlooking the pool. Very nice. Unfortunately, we were a bit sour already from the van pick-up/check-in fiasco, but again we were on vacation so let's enjoy! Oh, and as a side note, we learned at check-in that breakfast was not included with our stay as we did not book through the hotel, but they would throw in breakfast because of the mix-up. This did appease my hostility a bit, until breakfast time....... So, the first day was good. Breakfast is between 7am - 10am and was under a nice eating area by the pool. Very quaint and very cute. Loving this. The cook on our first morning made a delicious traditional Mexican breakfast and it was great! Leisurely breakfast, dip in the pool, switch rooms, head to the beach. Pretty good first day. Then there was breakfast the 2nd day. We would soon learn that if you were not at breakfast between 7am - 8am (even though it is served, sort of, until 10am), you would be left with rubber eggs, a few slices of bread and hard bagels, some weary looking fruit, 2 cold pancakes (not each - just 2) and a version of Choco-puff cereal. No milk left though, only cream. On a bright note, the coffee was excellent. Needless to say, we did not enjoy our included breakfast for the next 6 days as we were not planning on getting up at 7 just to get the bacon that was supposedly included with the meal. 3 strikes so far and we were only on day 2. We did however find the hotel not bad for the price. The rooms were clean (even though I had to ask for the room to be made up, and to get fresh towels twice after returning from a full day of exploring Playa and it's beautiful beaches etc), and the location is fantastic. It's right by the bustling 5th street and literally no more than a 5 min walk from the beach. We found Playa del Carmen a bit on the pricey side, but we were glad to have visited. If you do go, head down 5th to an excellent wine & tapas bar called 'Bites'. It is just wonderful and a pleasant get away on the eardrums with their cool jazz/laid back tunes rather than the constant DJ thump-thump that seems to pour out of every restaurant and bar. All in all, we found the hotel and it's staff to be pleasant, but not super accommodating and definitely not as fabulous as mentioned in other reviews. You could certainly tell who the regular visitors were though, because the staff seemed to be extra helpful to them. We would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great price and an excellent location, but we will for sure try a different hotel or even an all inclusive if we were to ever come back to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect slice of peacefulness.”
Reviews.Author: dr_moooo
Reviews.Content: With only 13 rooms in a quiet tropical courtyard, this small boutique hotel really is a great environment for chilling out. The room was just what we wanted (front balcony with chairs, clean, big bed that was reasonably comfortable, locking safe, fridge, good shower, iPod dock), the pool (small but clean and a nice temp) and surroundings were excellently maintained, and although the location is just off of 5th Ave, there was no noise. It was quite hot during the week (certainly around 30 Celcius) but the room was cooled enough with just the ceiling fan, never needed the air conditioner. Breakfast is fresh and delicious. The front desk service is excellent - could not be more helpful or dependable, all advice given was honest and reliable and cheerful. When compared to another nearby hotel we had to stay in for our final night in Playa (we opted to stay 1 more night but there was not an available room), The Bric was much more enjoyable, reliable, quiet and of good value.

Reviews.Title: “charming boutique type hotel hidden just off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: rdparson
Reviews.Content: Very charming boutique type hotel at the end of the main strip, it is tucked up a little street 1/2 block from Starbucks for all you coffee lovers, 3 good blocks from beach, and a short walk to all the fine restaurants in Playa. The staff were very accomidating and pleasant and English spoken by some. the center courtyard and pool, lovely for relaxing around. It was very clean! Would reccommend for anyone not wanting an all-inclusive and like to do find and do things for themselves. I would stay there again with hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, I love to spend some day in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Renatofr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very charming and well located....close to the beach and 5th ave. This place is quiet and confotable...look like my own house. I love to stay a couple days there. Next year i will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bhondablue
Reviews.Content: the bric is really really a wonderful beautiful spot to stay. we were there for two weeks. the breakfasts alone made it outstanding. patti (and carlos on thurs) make a breakfast you always wanted. eggs, bacon, saus, toast, bagels, rolls, fresh fresh oj, good coffee, pancakes so light they float, fruit, ceral, yogurt and it is served from 7 to 10 so can eat and go or laze about and eat and eat. staff speak english like you do in the office and they go out of there way to be helpful. rooms were clean and fresh. it was only 5 or 6 minutes to the fabulous beach and 5th ave right outside the door and a few feet. the pictures of pool and courtyard on the internet are, if anything, not even as beautiful as it really is. safe, secure, quiet. the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just right amount of amenities”
Reviews.Author: andyplusdrew
Reviews.Content: A great, affordable hotel steps away from 5th avenue and the beach. Great amenities for the price... hot continental breakfast, comfortable mattresses, complimentary beach towels. Friendly staff, Avril provided towels and pointed us in the right direction

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, awesome value!”
Reviews.Author: karma_78
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 10 day stay at the Bric Hotel and loved the place. No bells and whistles but very clean and conveniently located (right on 5th Ave. and a 5 to 10 minute walk to the beach 3 blocks away), and the staff was wonderful. Our room (room 25) was very large and clean, and the beds comfortable. The hotel is very quiet at night and it's hard to believe you're just a few feet away from 5th Ave.! The breakfast was the BEST: pancakes, eggs, bacon, freshly squeezed orange juice, yoghurt, fruit, and is included in the room rate. The breakfast lady Patti (sp?) is the sweetest lady ever. The hotel pool is lovely and the yard is gorgeous. The only negatives: there weren't any hair dryers in the rooms or at the reception, and we spent an evening/night without any hot water due to a plumbing issue. Other than that our stay was wonderful and we would definitely stay the Bric again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to beach, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: momsadoc
Reviews.Content: Short walk to the beach, close to Avenida Quinta but away from the noise. Staff was friendly and helpful - e.g. Laminated my business card when I realized I had lost my luggage tag since no one was sure where to purchase a new one). Room was clean, some minor electrical problems - noisy ceiling fan, a non-functional wall outlet, but air conditioning and good lighting. Full buffet breakfast, although food not always available if not out early when it was served.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil & cute 2-star”
Reviews.Author: Chula_Banana
Reviews.Content: As so many have said, a cute property in a great location. It compares with the Aventura Mexicana and the Hacienda Paradise, which are both very close by. I think the location here is slightly better - closer to the newer part of Playa and beach access is direct down 28th. The rate is fixed all year round, so in high season this hotel is also the best value of the three. (But perhaps the worst at other times). It is also the quietest, so if you are looking for something very peaceful, this is the place for you. Hacienda is much bigger and it has some rooms backing on 10th avenue which can be noisy. But the Bric is very small and all the rooms face the courtyard and unlike Aventuras, there is no bar in the hotel nor any music blaring to keep you awake. Come her for peace and quiet but not if you want to party with the other guests. Breakfast is better than Aventuras, but not as good as Hacienda. There is not a lot of variety and they did run out of stuff if we didn't come early enough or weren't patient enough to wait for the one person looking after the buffet to replenish what we were waiting for. But what they had was good, including scrambled eggs and bacon and we always left the table satisfied. The balcony was more spacious and private than at the Aventura and although the pool was smaller, we always had it to ourselves. We had no complaints and would not hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place, great value - not a lot of bells and whistles but quaint”
Reviews.Author: 8tinkerbell8
Reviews.Content: We had mixed feelings when we checked in based on all the great reviews once we saw our room- we only initially booked for a couple nights and were going to move but after reviewing the value and choices in Playa decided to stay here the entire time and we did not regret it. BRIC is a CUTE place don't get me wrong but it's definitely no frills, the staff is very friendly and helpful which is also a big plus and partly what convinced us to just stay on. The massage therapist Emily IS THE BOMB. I highly recommend booking her if you stay - she is as inexpensive as on the beach and WAY better. The cons/concerns: ALL the beds are 2 full size beds pushed together to make a king size - that is the ONLY issue really we had and was a bit disappointing for our romantic get away. We asked if we could change rooms and told that all the rooms were this way. I did read it in a review but discarded it thinking maybe only some rooms were this way- IF YOU WON'T BE HAPPY WITH THIS TYPE OF SET UP THEN DON'T BOOK IT AS YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED. We sleep spooning the whole night anyway so we could have even dealt with cramped space (otherwise someone gets the crack) but the bed was super hard & uncomfortable. Based on looking at all other hotels in this price range EVERY hotel has rock hard beds, unless you want to pay 300 plus a night just get that in your head. In hind sight had we been smart we would have ran to the local Walmart (yes they have one) and bought an eggshell crate to use and throw away that week for the 20 or 25 we would have spent that would have solved the crack problem and the hardness issue - that would have made ALL the difference in our sleep quality and would have been totally worth it. Entrance into the rooms - I will also point out that as in previous reviews the doors to the rooms are ONLY glass sliding doors (like a patio door) and the locks feel a little ramshackle BUT there is a safe in the room and security on site at night to only let the guests in - so we had no issues whatsoever. It made me very nervous the first night but then I said to hell with it and quit worrying and I felt pretty secure. If you are someone who would worry about that keep that in mind. We are a couple who basically wanted a clean, inexpensive, decent room to sleep in so we could spend our money on food and entertainment. There is no phone in the room (which was a HUGE plus for us) . I read other reviews complaining about this hotel wanting you not to put toilet paper in the toilet but in the waste can next to it. Understand Playa is on a septic system - you will find this sign in EVERY single bathroom in Playa so it's not really a fair criticism to this hotel. Overall after looking at several alternate hotels before we were to check out we ended up staying because it is a very cute hotel right off 5th and a great value comparatively. The Pros: The little breakfast was quite good each morning, coffee was good and we had a nice little patio right outside the pool to eat our breakfast and relax - we would not have had that quaint little condo atmosphere anywhere else we looked which factored in us deciding to tough out the crappy bed and stay. The staff is spectacular - they are friendly and helpful and were super accommodating when we encountered a transaction/banking snafu with a local merchant - they could not have been nicer. Consequently ONLY rent a car from a major company like Avis or Hertz (you'll find them on 5th avenue) DO NOT - I REPEAT DO NOT rent from little local car rental agencies - they do not disclose all charges and will tie your money up. Emily the massage therapist - wish I could clone her and have her at home with me - TOTALLY worth it - she is knowledgeable, friendly and gives a wonderful massage. The pool is impeccable - it was too cold to use while we were there but in the courtyard it really is a cool little place. Overall it's a great place, great convenient location - I wish they would invest in some way to make the bed situation better and perhaps put a more secure locking mechanism on the door but other than that I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jeweljem
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Bric and enjoyed it very much. The staff were as helpful as could be, trying to answer all our questions. Hotel was close to beach clubs and shopping. The breakfast was awsome with eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, fresh fruit and fresh fruit juice. Best of all the pancakes. We had a really relaxing time here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: rstaich
Reviews.Content: Going into Mexico you never know what to expect but the Bric Hotel was not only very nice & clean but the staff was very accomodating and friendly. They had a free continental breakfast each morning which was good enough to eat everyday. It has a great location being a few blocks from the beach and literally right next to about 10-15 casual to fine dining restaurants, starbucks, Ah Cacao (better then starbucks/great coffee cafe). best of all it was quiet and well landscaped. A nice little spot to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “I love the BRIC Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jlb085
Reviews.Content: Just finished our second stay at the BRIC Hotel on 28th between 5th and 10th in Playa del Carmen. It is the perfect location and the perfect hotel! The staff is awesome and extremely helpful, the rooms are great, and the attention to detail is awesome! The courtyard and pool are the perfect place to just do nothing! Last but not least Patty's pancakes at breakfast are unbelievable! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “While Not On the Beach, it is close. Great location around the corner from 5th.”
Reviews.Author: ABeaglePI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were a little bit nervous before the trip. We have been to numerous places in the Caribbean including Playa Del Carmen once before. However, every time we stay anywhere, it is all inclusive. This time we decided to try a non all inclusive. We came across the Bric Hotel by looking on various rental sites i.e. VRBO, Homeaway, etc. A representative from Bric rentals called me the next day. The hotel is situated on 28th street right between 5th and 10th avenues. The location, which was of course right around the corner from the famous 5th avenue, was great. It was also only approximately a 5 minute walk to Mamita's beach (2 streets down). I was offered a nice rate of $50.00 US a night and the hotel also provided breakfast which could be eaten at the Palapa in the center of the complex, or could be delivered to your room. Also in the middle of the complex there was a very nice and clean (a little small) swimming pool that we used quite a bit. As for the rooms, they were a bit small. One thing that was strange is the entry and only door to your room was a glass sliding door that could be locked with a provided key. They also had an in room safe (In the closet) and key as well. The floors were all tile. The sleeping area had a King size (made of two mattresses pushed together unfortunately) bed that was on a concrete platform. The bed was very firm, but slept well. There was an end table on each side of the bed along with lamps. There were a couple of storage shelfs on the wall and an entertainment center with about a 20" tv with cable and a mini fridge. The bathroom had a nice size shower and sink and toilet. It was a little discouraging that the hotel required you to put all hygiene products in the trashcan beside the toilet including toilet paper instead of flushing. We had a housekeeper every day that would come, make our beds, empty our trash, etc (She unfortunately would turn off the A/C as well). At night the hotel had a watchman and was gated. The breakfast was pretty nice consisting of scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, cereal, yogurt, pancakes, fruit, and juice. Everything was fresh made. Wi-Fi was included as well at the hotel. All in all for the money this hotel was great. The staff were amazing and would help you to find anything you needed and would even get groceries for you. The only negative thing I have to say is, when we booked we were provided with 3 grocery lists. We picked the largest one ($75.00 + Liquor) that included things to cook, however when we arrived we found out the rooms had no cooking area (stove, microwave, etc.). I assume some of their rentals in other areas had these amenities. We very much enjoyed this hotel and we will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Mexico Road Trip- PdC”
Reviews.Author: mathewpressy
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant time at the Bric. The staff was extremely helpful- Abril/ Ruben couldn't be more courteous. We initially stayed for two nights, then upon returning from Tulum/ Coba, stayed an additional 3 nights. We simply couldn't find a better value that could come close to Bric. As most of the reviews mention- great location, nice courtyard and excellent full breakfast- worked perfectly for us traveling with two small children. Since we were driving a rental car, I worried about the parking/ safety. There was no issues at all. There was some construction going on in the afternoon, which would have made a mid-afternoon siesta challenging, but we were too busy walking all around 5th Ave and beyond. The laundry service just around the corner is perfect- just pack for a few days, and launder as needed for extended stays. We would absolutely recommend this property, especially when deals can be had in the slow Oct. month.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Absolutely Lovely!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovesthebeach5031
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at The Bric. We just arrived back home yesterday and I couldn't wait to write a wonderful review of our stay. The service was superb all around! Everyone was friendly. And their room rates are extremely affordable. We have been there done that with all inclusive hotels and found we are not the all inclusive types...so this was exactly what we were looking for. Breakfast was more than your typical continental! Fresh squeezed juice, coffee, pancakes, eggs, bacon, cereal, yogurt and fruit. Rooms are a little small but just the right size for two people. More than enough room to hang our clothes, Very clean and comfortable. Included a safe, as well. Pool and courtyard area is tidy and well kept. Pool is nice and refreshing after an afternoon at the beach. Location was perfect. 5 min walk to the beach and just 1/2 blocks off of 5th Ave where all the action is at. Even with being so close you do not hear anything from 5th Ave. Our experience at The Bric and Playa Del Carmen was very memorable. Can't wait to return in the future...we would definitely stay at The Bric again and miss it already.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LaliLaliLali
Reviews.Content: We went to the Bric Hotel for our honey moon and found it very cozy and confortable. We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “a-mazing!”
Reviews.Author: cmohr
Reviews.Content: We only go on one trip a year with our children who are "Teens"! We had a room to ourselves and our children had a room next door. Wonderful accommodations and even with the kids next door we all felt safe. The hotel is very clean and very quiet. Each room has it's own AC unit. The cleaning staff is excellent and Patty in the kitchen is amazing. She also knew what we needed/wanted before we knew! Concierge services are also on top of anything and everything you may want! We will be back and may make this our yearly trip for ourselves and kids!

Reviews.Title: “It is an awesome place that I would definetly return to!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlb085
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Close to the action but quiet. Perfect for familes and singles and couples! Not many places can say that! The pancakes at breakfast are the best ever! The staff is great and happy to help you with your needs.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Marlies407
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located just perfect, close to 5th Ave and Mamita's Beach just between 5th and 10th. Sitting at pool side in the courtyard makes you feel like being somewhere very remote and cozy. Pattie's breakfast under the palapa was always great (got to have her pancakes). The staff is very friendly and most speek english. We will be back, one week was too short.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, warm welcome, what more could I say?”
Reviews.Author: chrhum
Reviews.Content: My wife and her family just spent a week at the BRIC Hotel on 28th street between 5th and 10th ave - the north end of Playa del Carmen. Fifth Avenue is open to foot traffic only and runs from the norh to the south to catch the ferry boat over to Cozumel around 2nd street. Though not directly on the beach, the hotel is well located near Mamitas Beach - less than a 5 minute walk. The staff is always welcoming and helpful. Emily, the on-site massage therapist spent 2 hours taking away the stress of a bad flight and less than good golf outing. Rooms were cozy and clean with individual AC units, wide selection of complimentary breakfast foods and fresh squeezed OJ.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great acomodations... above and beyond expections”
Reviews.Author: Clevermav
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay at Bric. The room was simple, well air conditioned and very clean. The well balanced breakfast with fresh squeezed OJ made my morning and the high speed Wifi poolside was definitely a plus. Easy access to quinta (the main shopping strip) and 5 minute walking distance to the most happening beach in Playa (Mamitas) combined with a stellar english speaking concierge service (that went out of their way retrieve my valuble Nikon camera accidentally left on a tour bus) topped off my stay. I will definitely be back! -D.Godenick

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: sebas0710
Reviews.Content: We had a really great time staying at the BRIC. Location is perfect. Two blocks from the beach and half a block from 5ta Avenida. The staff (Abril, Ruben and Patty) were super friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean. The swimming pool added a lot of value to have a mix and match with the beach. Patty prepared very good breakfasts. In summary, great experience at a totally reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MuffieNanaimo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time staying at the Bric Hotel in Playa. The staff are so friendly and helpful. Thanks to their recommendations, we were able to visit places we would not have found on our own. The rooms are so clean, with air conditioning. The pool and surrounding area are lovely. The hotel is 5 minutes from shops and restaurants, and 10 minutes walk to a beautiful beach. The cooked breakfast by the pool was a treat, and the staff keep the rooms and area so clean. The area is very safe, and I felt comfortable walking and travelling on buses on my own. There is some traffic noise from, but the air conditioner blocked that out. I hope to go again one day. Linda (Nanaimo, BC)
